meanings.definition: A lung disease caused by inhaling silica dust.
meanings.sent1: Silicosis can result from breathing in tiny particles of silica dust.
meanings.sent2: The doctor diagnosed the patient with silicosis after learning about their exposure to silica dust.
meanings.sent3: The comedian joked that he developed silicosis from accidentally inhaling his powdered sugar dessert.
meanings.sent4: Her love for dusty antique books gave her a metaphorical case of silicosis in her imagination.
meanings.sent5: The image of the dusty attic filled with old books stuck in her mind like a case of silicosis.

meanings.definition: The chronic form of silicosis can lead to scarring of the lungs.
meanings.sent1: Long-term exposure to silica dust can result in the chronic form of silicosis.
meanings.sent2: The scarring caused by silicosis can make breathing difficult for patients.
meanings.sent3: The idea of lungs getting tattoos from silicosis scars amused the group of friends.
meanings.sent4: The relentless coughing felt like the lungs were battling a fierce silicosis dragon.
meanings.sent5: The permanent damage from silicosis left a lasting mark on the patient's health.

meanings.definition: Silicosis is commonly seen in workers exposed to silica dust.
meanings.sent1: Workers in mines and construction sites are at risk of developing silicosis.
meanings.sent2: The safety regulations aim to protect workers from the dangers of silicosis.
meanings.sent3: The idea of a superhero fighting off silicosis villains entertained the children.
meanings.sent4: The battle against silicosis in the workplace requires strict safety measures.
meanings.sent5: The news of the latest silicosis outbreak raised concerns among the workers.
